intro: Aglaiopsis, commonly known as the evergreen tree or shrub, is a genus of flowering plants in the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to various regions in Africa, particularly in the southern parts of the continent. The plants are characterized by their compound leaves and showy, often fragrant flowers that come in a range of colors, including white, pink, and purple. Aglaiopsis species are typically deciduous or semi-deciduous, adapting to seasonal changes in their native environments. They play an important ecological role in their habitats, providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
